page.title: 01 General Description
page.content: The area consists of part of the floodplain of the River Tame together with undulating land on either side. The floodplain itself is still agricultural land but on the higher land are the older settlements of Fazeley and Wilnecote. The area is crossed by the A5 Trunk road, the A51, the A4091 and the railway from Birmingham to Tamworth and the north.. Coal mining used to be important in the area and much of the newer housing is built on reclaimed mining land. These newer estates of Glascote and Belgrave are part of Tamworth expanded town and were planned to house overspill population from Birmingham. There is some light industry in the area including the Reliant car factory.
